Legal_Issue: Can the applicants' removal to St. Vincent be stayed pending judicial review of their PRRA decision?
Application_Facts: Ms. Brown and her son fled domestic abuse in St. Vincent, were denied asylum in Canada, and sought a stay of removal.
Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal pending judicial review
Court_Ruling: Stay of removal granted until judicial review is resolved
Claimant_Status: Applicants: Ms. Brown and her son
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of domestic abuse in St. Vincent due to lack of state protection
Legal_Standard: RJR-MacDonald test for stay: (1) serious issue on the merits, (2) irreparable harm, (3) balance of convenience favors applicants
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review application filed; stay requested
Review_Standard: Serious issue on the merits, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Credibility_Assessment: PRRA officer found Ms. Brown credible
Evidence_Used: Lack of state protection in St. Vincent
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution and harm upon return to St. Vincent
Evidence_Assessed: Country condition evidence regarding domestic violence in St. Vincent
Harm_Assessment: Irreparable harm due to risk of domestic abuse
Cause_Description: Ms. Brown and her son fled domestic abuse in St. Vincent, were denied asylum in Canada, and sought a stay of removal.
Evidence_Handling: PRRA officer assessed evidence but concluded country was safe despite credibility finding
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence showed potential threats; applicant deemed credible
Decision_Rationale: Applicants meet all three criteria for a stay: serious issue, irreparable harm, and balance of convenience
